type: Veterinary Care for Aquatic Vertebrate Animals
short_summary: Provision of veterinarian care to aquatic vertebrate animals
description: Contractors will be responsible for ensuring the health and well-being of all aquatic vertebrate animals held in wet lab facilities at the Pacific Environmental Science Centre in North Vancouver, BC.
full_summary:
### **Veterinary Care for Aquatic Vertebrate Animals in Wet Lab Facilities** **Contract Reference:** cb-8518-69845415
**Solicitation Number:** 5000075635
**Publication Date:** 2023-08-25
**Tender Closing Date:** 2023-09-13T14:00:00
**Call for Proposals:** Environment and Climate Change Canada Procurement & Contracting Division is seeking proposals for the provision of veterinary care services for aquatic vertebrate animals in the wet lab facilities located at the Pacific Environmental Science Centre in North Vancouver, British Columbia. **Scope of Work:** The selected proponent will be responsible for providing veterinary care services to aquatic vertebrate animals (fishes, amphibians, and reptiles) held in the wet lab facility. This includes: * Regular health monitoring of the animals * Provision of veterinarian care as needed * Participation in the review of experimental animal care protocols * Participation in the revision and editing of standard operating procedures * Provision of advice to researchers regarding the care and maintenance of experimental animals * Monthly reporting to the departmental representative * Advice on training programs and competency/animal care training for project leaders and staff involved in animal research * Availability to respond to emergency situations in the wet lab facility **Contract Details:** * Expected contract start date: 2024-04-01 * Expected contract end date: 2025-03-31 * Regions of delivery: British Columbia, Vancouver * Regions of opportunity: Vancouver **Notice Type:** This is a Request for Proposal (RFP) under a competitive bidding process. **Selection Criteria:** The highest combined rating of technical merit and price will be used to select the winning proponent. **Attachments:** View the tender notice, proposed tender questions and answers, and Proponent Evaluation Form for more information. **Contact Information:** If you have any questions or concerns, please contact: Anthony De Flavis, Environment and Climate Change Canada anthony.deflavis@ec.gc.ca (438) 801-0777 .”

Please do not include the attachments, you only use the text that you have been given. Your job is simply to rephrase it to make it sound more formal and polished, and format it nicely in markdown format. Do not add any new information. Just reorganize to make it easy to read and rewrite in a clear and concise style.
